intro: Biatherium, commonly known as the moonflower vine, is a tropical climbing plant characterized by its large, fragrant white flowers that open at night. The plant belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is native to Central and South America. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, with a velvety texture, while its stems are woody and twining. The flowers emit a sweet scent to attract nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Due to its unique blooming pattern and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in warm climates for its beauty and fragrance.
